info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 6:14PM EDT until July 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... Central Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... Northern Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 614 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 17 miles south of Easley to near Anderson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Anderson, Homeland Park, Belton, Williamston, Honea Path, Lake Secession, Donalds, Starr, and Antreville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
